Health Department notice detailing quarantine rules that apply from 25 April: "Continued restrictions on all incoming international flights, with enhanced compliance for quarantine: (1) For PNG Citizens and Permanent Residents returning to PNG by aircraft, there are designated hotels for quarantine in Port Moresby at the individual’s cost, in addition to the designated facility provided by the Government’s; (2) All non-PNG Citizens and non Permanent Residents returning to PNG by aircraft must be quarantined at a designated hotel in Port Moresby at the individual’s cost; and (3) Foreign diplomats travelling on diplomatic travel document or diplomatic passport must self-quarantine at an appropriate residence, non-adherence shall be declared a persona non grata." Archived statement: https://web.archive.org/web/20200516225342/https://www.health.gov.pg/covid19/PNGSR19PCOVID-19(2020-05-03).pdf

Some airports are opened in some region for domestic travel while other are The four western border airports of Daru, Kiunga, Wewak and Vanimo, still require the approval of the State of Emergency (SoE) controller.  Air Niugini will continue to operate some flights to these three airports as we get approval, and will advertise when these flights are occurring 3-4 days in advance on our Facebook page.  Bookings for these four airports remains as per the normal process once they are advertised. Passengers traveling to or from these four airports, are not required to quarantine upon arrival.    Tabubil airport has been closed by Ok Tedi Mining Limited, similarly Lihir airport in New Ireland has been closed by Newcrest    Flights to Buka and Kieta airports in the Autonomous Region of Bougainville (ARoB) still require approval from the Bougainville  SoE Controller.  Air Niugini is operating occasional flights to Buka, based on Bougainville SoE Controller approval, but generally at present there is not any approval for uplift of passengers into Buka or Kieta. passengers must fall under five categories.hese are students returning to their educational institute, persons returning to their place of residence, persons traveling for essential services, persons travelling for essential exempted business travel, or persons travelling for emergency reasons such as but not limited to repatriation of deceased personshttps://web.archive.org/save/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/index.php/2020/04/26/updated-domestic-air-travel-requirements/

PM statement ;Universities throughout the country will resume classes next  Monday 27 , April 2020, while primary and secondary schools will begin classes,  on  Monday 4 May on a trial basis.https://web.archive.org/save/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/index.php/2020/04/24/prime-minister-announces-resumption-of-universities-and-schools/

National Emergency Orders number 16 and 17, issued 16/4/20 and 17/4/20 respectively, stipulate curfews for the residents of National Capital District and Western Province. The overnight curfew (initially 8pm-6am, changed to 9pm-6am) is said to apply until 30/4/20 unless extended by the Emergency Controller.   Archived order 16: https://web.archive.org/web/20200518212334/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/files/16-04-2020/NCD%20and%20Western%20Confirmed%20Case%20EO.pdf  Archived order 17: https://web.archive.org/web/20200518212343/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/files/19-04-2020/National%20Emergency%20Order%20No.17%20-%20Amend%20curfew.pdf

"We continue to carry out contact tracing of persons of interests of the 7 cases in East New Britain. Western province , National Capital District and Eastern Highlands.As of today, we have identified and collected 745 contacts of the National Capital District case.In addition we have collected 584 samples of two confirmed cases in East New Britain and 246 in Western Province".https://web.archive.org/save/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/index.php/2020/04/28/deputy-controller-acting-secretary-for-health-dr-paison-dakulala-statement/

National Emergency Order 29, issued 29/4/20, stipulates restrictions for Western Province. The restrictions are to apply until the end of the national emergency. There is a ban on gatherings of more than 4 people in public places. Customary gatherings also restricted to a maximum of 4. Archived statement: https://web.archive.org/web/20200518203737/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/files/May%202020/01052020/National%20Emergency%20Order%20No.%2029-Western%20Province-Restrictions.pdf

National Emergency Order 28, issued 29/4/20 and relevant to National Capital District and Western Province, stipulates that public transport may continue to operate during the national emergency as long as passenger numbers are limited to 5 fewer than the vehicle/vessel operating capacity. Archived order: https://web.archive.org/web/20200518204713/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/files/May%202020/01052020/National%20Emergency%20Order%20No.%2028-NCD%26CentralProvince-Restrictions.pdf

National Emergency Order 29 of 29/4/20 stipulates that residents of Western Province must adhere to a curfew between 10pm and 5am. National Emergency Order 27 of 29/4/20 stipulates that residents of East New Britain Province must also adhere to a curfew between 10pm and 5am.  These curfews are to continue until the end of the national emergency, unless repealed by the Emergency Controller.  Note, these curfews are in addition to curfews for residents of the National Capital District and Western Province, that were announced on 16 and 17 April and scheduled to finish on 30 April. Archived statement 29: https://web.archive.org/web/20200518203737/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/files/May%202020/01052020/National%20Emergency%20Order%20No.%2029-Western%20Province-Restrictions.pdf  Archived statement 27: https://web.archive.org/web/20200518205008/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/files/May%202020/01052020/National%20Emergency%20Order%20No.%2027-ENB%20Provincial%20Restrictions.pdf

National Emergency Order number 25, effective from 25/4/20, stipulates no persons may travel to or from Western Province, Sanduan Province, or East Sepik Province, except those from an authorised list. No flights are to operate to/from these provinces, nor movement of cargo. Flights to/from airports in other provinces are allowed. Archived statement: https://web.archive.org/web/20200518210732/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/files/26-04-2020/National%20Emergency%20Order%20No.25-Internation%20and%20Domestic%20travel.pdf

National Emergency Order 32 of 1/5/20 stipulates the approved equipment that can be used to test for COVID-19. Archived statement: https://web.archive.org/web/20200518202935/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/files/SOE%20Orders/National%20Emergency%20Order%20No.32-Testing%20machines.pdf    National Emergency Order 30 of 1/5/20 stipulates that no COVID-19 test results shall be released by any person or organisation without the express written authorisation of the Emergency Controller. Archived statement: https://web.archive.org/web/20200518203322/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/files/SOE%20Orders/National%20Emergency%20Order%20No.30-COVID-19%20Testing%20Restriction.PDF

The statement of Deputy Controller and acting secretary of health "We have tested more than 500 contacts of the two positive cases in the East New Britain Province.  We have traced and tested 746 contacts of the NCD Index case, which I along with the Prime Minister, cabinet ministers and the Controller were part of the stathttps://web.archive.org/save/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/index.php/2020/05/02/update-on-pngs-covid-19-response/

National Emergency Order 2, which took effect on 2/4/20, stipulated that gambling venues, night clubs and sporting venues were to close for the duration of the national emergency. It ordered that "essential services" remain open, including supermarkets, telecommunication providers, fuel stations, health services, banks, manufacturers and more. All other service providers were ordered to implement safe work practices.   With this in mind, C2 may need to be recoded back to 2/4/20.   Archived order: https://web.archive.org/web/20200518220154/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/files/02-04-2020/National%20Emergency%20Order%20No.2%20Business%20Operations%20&%20Socila%20Gatherings.pdf

Health Department document: "On 22 April, SOE Controller announced that the Universities and tertiary education resume on 27 April, Monday, and Primary and secondary schools resume on 4 May 2020." (p.6) Archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200516225342/https://www.health.gov.pg/covid19/PNGSR19PCOVID-19(2020-05-03).pdf

National Emergency Order 33 of 6/5/20 stipulates that only four authorised organisations can provide COVID-19 testing until the end of the national emergency. Archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200518202651/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/files/SOE%20Orders/National%20Emergency%20Order%20No.33-COVID-19%20Testing.pdf

National Emergency Order 25 of 13/5/20: "Flights to and from all airports are allowed, except as directed by the Controller." Archived: https://web.archive.org/web/20200518201628/https://covid19.info.gov.pg/files/National%20Emergency%20Order/National%20Emergency%20Order%20No.35-Lifting%20Flight%20Restrictions.pdf   [NB: This appears to refer to domestic flights, as the PNG border is still closed to foreign travellers.]

From 14 March 2020, shops located in shopping malls over 2,000 square meters are closed excluding grocery stores, drugstores, laundries and pharmacies; and all bars, restaurants, pubs, casinos and other similar places of entertainment are closed. Restaurants can, however, sell food for delivery.  https://www.premier.gov.pl/wydarzenia/aktualnosci/premier-bezpieczenstwo-zdrowotne-polakow-jest-najwazniejsze.html

No international inbound flights or trains would be allowed from March 15, except for some charter flights bringing Poles back from holidays.  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/03/coronavirus-travel-restrictions-border-shutdowns-country-200318091505922.html#

The President announced during briefing that in the case of companies that decide to maintain jobs, the government will subsidize 40 percent of the average wage for each employee: https://web.archive.org/web/20200507075657/https://www.prezydent.pl/aktualnosci/wypowiedzi-prezydenta-rp/wystapienia/art,1018,wypowiedzi-prezydenta-i-premiera-po-posiedzeniu-rady-gabinetowej.html

The governments hygiene/sanitation inspectorate (in charge of coordinating COVID testing) issues its official policy on Mar 22, allowing for people symtomatic (with fever, cough) to be tested if they meet a list of conditions (e.g. returning from another country with local COVID transmission; close contact with someone who is a confirmed COVID case).     http://web.archive.org/web/20200402174409/https://gis.gov.pl/aktualnosci/definicja-przypadku-na-potrzeby-nadzoru-nad-zakazeniami-ludzi-nowym-koronawirusem-sars-cov-2/

all events and gatherings are now outlawed: 'Ban on all kinds of gatherings, meetings and events, except for those attended by the members of the immediate family or people living together.'    https://www.premier.gov.pl/en/news/news/prime-minister-in-the-battle-against-the-coronavirus-we-must-reduce-our-mobility-to-an.html

The school closures, initially slated to run until Mar 25, have been extended until April 10.   'Zmienilismy przepisy, dzieki którym mozliwe jest prowadzenie ksztalcenia na odleglosc. Nowe prawo obowiazuje od 25 marca do 10 kwietnia 2020'    http://web.archive.org/web/20200329223015/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/informacje-dla-uczniow-i-studentow

Events and gatherings of more than 50 people remain illegal; new rules mandate the closure of parks, beaches, and squares/boulevards   http://web.archive.org/save/https://www.premier.gov.pl/wydarzenia/aktualnosci/premier-w-walce-z-koronawirusem-musimy-utrzymac-dystans-spoleczny.html

According to the announcement of the Polish government:  - 90% reduction rents for tenants of premises and the so-called islands in shopping malls, as long as these facilities are prohibited from operating normally;  - exemption from charging contractual penalties for - related to the epidemic - delays in the execution of tenders;  - enabling municipalities to refrain from charging real estate tax on companies that have lost their liquidity due to the coronavirus epidemic.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200507081400/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/tarcza

Any assembly, meeting, event or meeting of more than 2 persons is prohibited. This restriction does not apply to meetings with loved ones [residing together]. See: https://web.archive.org/web/20200331121008/www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia

People may only leave the house to go to and from work (for those in essential service jobs), volunteer on Covid-19 relief efforts, and for basic needs such as groceries, pharmacy visits, caring for loved ones. Children under teh age of 18 cannot leave the house without a legal adult guardian. https://web.archive.org/web/20200331121008/www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia

People should not be traveling between cities and regions unless for essential needs including helping a loved one, or otherwise for essential service work/volunteerism https://web.archive.org/web/20200331121008/www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia

'Ban on all private gatherings and festivities'. Those in Poland may only spend time with those with whom they reside in the same household. see: https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia
Public transport use is limited to 50% of available seating to maintain appropriate distance between passengers.  https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/poland/coronavirus

People can now enjoy pedestrian walks and time outside with 2 meter distance between each other. Children under the age of 18 cannot leave the house without adult supervision.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.gov.pl/web/koronawirus/aktualne-zasady-i-ograniczenia

Despite a gradual easing of restrictions, which came into effect on April 20th, "all public gatherings and events are still banned". (http://web.archive.org/web/20200511101827/https://www.poland.travel/en/travel-inspirations/safety-advice-for-travellers-concerning-the-covid-19-epidemic)

"Children over 13 years of age may leave their place of residence without adult supervision." (http://web.archive.org/web/20200511101827/https://www.poland.travel/en/travel-inspirations/safety-advice-for-travellers-concerning-the-covid-19-epidemic)

Gradual ease of restrictions begins. " reopening forests, parks, beaches, boardwalks, and usage of city bikes. Playgrounds remain closed. Mandatory face-covering remains in effect for all the public spaces." (http://web.archive.org/web/20200511101827/https://www.poland.travel/en/travel-inspirations/safety-advice-for-travellers-concerning-the-covid-19-epidemic)

"Hotels, shops, shopping centres, museums and galleries reopened on 4 May, with one customer per 15 sq m of space allowed". (http://web.archive.org/web/20200511100740/https://www.bbc.com/news/explainers-52575313) "shopping malls (although recreational and restaurant spaces remain closed and no more than 1 person for every 15 square metres is allowed);  construction shops only on weekends;  hotels and short-term accommodation (terms apply);  public cultural institutions, such as museums, libraries and art galleries;  medical rehabilitation centres are all being reopened" (http://web.archive.org/web/20200511100912/https://www.themayor.eu/en/poland-enters-the-second-stage-of-lifting-coronavirus-restrictions)

Despite the reopening of shopping malls and hotels, there still remains high control over congestion restrictions. (http://web.archive.org/web/20200511101827/https://www.poland.travel/en/travel-inspirations/safety-advice-for-travellers-concerning-the-covid-19-epidemic)

Further easing of restrictions: "- opening of shopping malls with congestion restrictions    - opening of hotels. On-site restaurants to remain closed    - reinstating inpatient medical rehabilitation treatments    - Limited opening of museums, art galleries, and libraries" (http://web.archive.org/web/20200511101827/https://www.poland.travel/en/travel-inspirations/safety-advice-for-travellers-concerning-the-covid-19-epidemic)

"The Interior Minister of Poland, Mariusz Kaminski has signed an amendment to the regulation on internal border control in order to extend the border controls until May 13." "After Wednesday 6 May nurseries and kindergartens will reopen, too, but only for those children, whose parents go to work and cannot take care of them during the day. Verified and recoded Lucy Goodfellow’s original data:  “School closures announced, Saturday 14th March, technically in place 16th March (14th, 15th are weekend).”  The information is still current: https://edition.cnn.com/2020/04/18/us/schools-closed-coronavirus/index.html   https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/15/us/coronavirus-puerto-rico.html https://web.archive.org/web/20200415124929/https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/live-blog/coronavirus-updates-live-house-approves-coronavirus-aid-bill-n1158821/ncrd1158961

Verified and Recoded Tanya Hameed’s answer about a general lock down in Puerto Rico:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200416104103/https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/15/us/coronavirus-puerto-rico.html  The lockdown was extended until May 3: “Gov. Wanda Vázquez said non-essential businesses will remain closed and that people have to remain indoors from 9 p.m. to 5 a.m., leaving outside those hours only to buy food or medicine or go to the bank. However, she lifted all license plate restrictions and said hardware stores and car repair shops can operate twice a week on limited schedules.”  https://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/puerto-rico-extends-lockdown-fight-covid-19-70104993  https://www.nytimes.com/aponline/2020/04/15/world/americas/ap-cb-virus-outbreak-puerto-rico.html

"the U.S. territory of Puerto Rico declared a state of emergency, while prohibiting all large gatherings and ordering the National Guard to begin health screenings at points of entry." https://web.archive.org/web/20200314213657/https://www.miamiherald.com/news/nation-world/world/americas/haiti/article241136896.html

"Chiding Puerto Ricans for failing to heed warnings to stay home and observe social distancing, Gov. Wanda Vázquez signed an executive order instituting a two-week closure for the majority of businesses on the island, and a 9 p.m. overnight curfew through March 30... “Given that the response from some citizens has not been adequate under the emergency situation, our priority is health and to protect the life of all of us who live on this island,” Ms. Vázquez said in a special televised address. “All citizens will have to stay home to stop the spread of this virus.”" https://web.archive.org/web/20200315211221/https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/15/us/coronavirus-puerto-rico.html    Citizens only allowed to go outside for essential activities.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504214638/https://www.fmcsa.dot.gov/emergency/pr-declaration-emergency

From March 15 onwards public transport is restricted to specific exceptions (buying groceries, pharmaceutical goods, or attending health related appointments. See Guidance and reports:  https://www.littler.com/files/transportation_guidance.pdf   https://www.littler.com/publication-press/publication/puerto-rico-governor-issues-executive-order-imposing-significant

"This curfew will allow citizens to travel or walk along public roads from 5:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. only on the following circumstances:    (a) Purchasing food, pharmaceutical, and basic necessity products;    (b) keeping medical appointments or visiting a hospital, laboratory, or healthcare facility; (c) going or coming from a workplace whose closure has not been ordered hereunder, public and private employees who perform essential work; (d) returning to your usual place of residence from an allowed activity; (e) to provide assistance, care, transportation of senior citizens, children, dependents, people with disabilities or people who require any type of medical or professional attention. The above, provided that all necessary precautions are taken to prevent infection; (f) visiting financial institutions."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504214638/https://www.fmcsa.dot.gov/emergency/pr-declaration-emergency

"This curfew will allow citizens to travel or walk along public roads from 5:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. only on the following circumstances:    (a) Purchasing food, pharmaceutical, and basic necessity products;    (b) keeping medical appointments or visiting a hospital, laboratory, or healthcare facility; (c) going or coming from a workplace whose closure has not been ordered hereunder, public and private employees who perform essential work; (d) returning to your usual place of residence from an allowed activity; (e) to provide assistance, care, transportation of senior citizens, children, dependents, people with disabilities or people who require any type of medical or professional attention. The above, provided that all necessary precautions are taken to prevent infection; (f) visiting financial institutions."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200504214638/https://www.fmcsa.dot.gov/emergency/pr-declaration-emergency

Since March 15, President Trump announced the prohibition of tourists from certain countries of Europe. Since March 17, officials at the airports were controlling passegers (measuring temperature): http://periodismoinvestigativo.com/2020/04/pasajeros-llegan-a-puerto-rico-desde-las-zonas-de-mayor-contagio-por-coronavirus-en-estados-unidos/   https://www.elnuevodia.com/noticias/locales/nota/todopasajeroqueingreseapuertoricoserasometidoaunapruebarapidadecoronavirus-2560770/  The Governor of Puerto Rico requested the Federal Government to suspend domestic and international flights, but the request has not been answered:  https://www.elnuevodia.com/negocios/economia/nota/aunnorespondelafaaasolicitudderestringirllegadadevuelos-2560784/  https://www.efe.com/efe/usa/puerto-rico/puerto-rico-pide-autoridad-federal-prohibir-vuelos-de-zonas-alta-prevalencia-covid/50000110-4216708

Since March 16: “Payment plans moratorium. Taxpayers economically affected by COVID-19 and the closure order will not be required to follow the terms of a payment plan between the period March 16, 2020, and April 30, 2020. The PRTD will not be imposing interest and penalties for non-compliance with the payment plans. If there is a notice for interest and penalties, the taxpayer may submit a request to eliminate such charges.”  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501022500/https://home.kpmg/xx/en/home/insights/2020/04/puerto-rico-tax-developments-in-response-to-covid-19.html  Since March 23: “From Monday, March 23 through June 30, 2020, no income tax shall be withheld on payments for services rendered as required under Section 1062.03 of the PR IRC related to services rendered by residents of Puerto Rico carried out. This exemption will apply regardless of whether the recipient has a total or partial release of this withholding tax. AD 20-10 clarifies that this withholding exemption does not exempt the recipient from any income tax on the amounts received and the withholding agent of the reporting requirements for the amounts paid”. Here's the link:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501020455/https://www.hlb.global/puerto-rico-tax-and-financial-measures-associated-with-covid-19/  Sine March 23: “No penalties will be imposed for missing or insufficient estimated tax payments, which are required by individuals and corporations for tax year 2020; the penalties will not be imposed if the first and second installment payments are timely made in equal amounts by the due dates of the next two estimated installments, together with the corresponding estimated income tax payments due. Withholding agents are not required to do the 10% income tax withholding at source on payments for services performed, but the service provider may choose to have the withholding continue; the waiver from the withholding is temporary during the period from 23 March 2020 to 30 June 2020.” Here's the link:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501022937/https://www.ey.com/en_gl/tax-alerts/puerto-rico-s-treasury-department-announces-additional-extensions-for-various-returns-and-payments-and-provides-special-cash-flow-tax-relief-measures-because-of-covid-19  “"The Electric Power Authorities (PREPA) and the Aqueduct and Sewer Authority (AAA) cannot suspend the electricity and water service while the executive orders for the emergency are in force by COVID-19.”  http://web.archive.org/web/20200501023705/https://www.efe.com/efe/usa/puerto-rico/normativa-prohibe-el-corte-de-la-luz-y-agua-durante-emergencia-covid-19/50000110-4218441

"She also said vehicles with license plates ending in even numbers can only be on the road Monday, Wednesday and Friday.  Vehicles with tags ending in odd numbers are only permitted to move about on Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday." https://web.archive.org/web/20200327234203/https://www.voanews.com/science-health/coronavirus-outbreak/puerto-rico-extends-coronavirus-curfew

Revision of the protocol from March 16th, no changes in testing criteria. For patients with symptoms, the decision to test is based on the clinician's judgement.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200506100350/http://www.salud.gov.pr/PublishingImages/Pages/coronavirus/protocolo%20cernimiento%20ADULTOS.jpg

Protocol for contact tracing prepared by the Task Force by the end of March. "She adjusted the executive order by canceling the vehicle restrictions and moving the curfew from 7 p.m. to 5 a.m. to 9 p.m. to 5 a.m." https://web.archive.org/web/20200412231709/https://abcnews.go.com/US/coronavirus-hits-puerto-rico-turmoil-hurricane-maria/story?id=70077411    "This curfew will allow citizens to travel or walk along public roads from 5:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. only on the following circumstances:  (a) Purchasing food, pharmaceutical, and basic necessity products;  (b) keeping medical appointments or visiting a hospital, laboratory, or healthcare facility; (c) going or coming from a workplace whose closure has not been ordered hereunder, public and private employees who perform essential work; (d) returning to your usual place of residence from an allowed activity; (e) to provide assistance, care, transportation of senior citizens, children, dependents, people with disabilities or people who require any type of medical or professional attention. People are required to remain at home 24/7. They are allowed to leave their houses only to buy basic supplies from 5am until 7pm. https://web.archive.org/web/20200506110406/https://www.fortaleza.pr.gov/content/gobernadora-v-zquez-garced-restablece-el-toque-de-queda-las-700-pm

"This order for total closure shall apply to shopping centers, movie theaters, dance clubs, concert halls, theaters, game or gambling rooms, casinos amusement parks, gyms, bars, or any similar place or event that may promote the gathering of a group of citizens in the same place." https://www.fmcsa.dot.gov/emergency/pr-declaration-emergency

"This order for total closure shall apply to shopping centers, movie theaters, dance clubs, concert halls, theaters, game or gambling rooms, casinos amusement parks, gyms, bars, or any similar place or event that may promote the gathering of a group of citizens in the same place." https://www.fmcsa.dot.gov/emergency/pr-declaration-emergency    Under stay at home order with curfew: “All citizens will have to stay home to stop the spread of this virus.” https://web.archive.org/web/20200315211221/https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/15/us/coronavirus-puerto-rico.html

The Task Force recommends that schools should remain closed until the end of the "reopening phase" of the country. See pages 8 and 9. https://web.archive.org/web/20200506150429/https://covid19tf.rcm.upr.edu/wp-content/uploads/sites/45/2020/04/ROADMAP-REOPENING-APRIL-25-FINAL-3PM.pdf

Only flights from US mainland and other unincorporated islands are allowed. All commercial flights go to the same airport where passengers are screened on arrival. https://web.archive.org/web/20200506164019/https://www.fortaleza.pr.gov/content/gobierno-de-puerto-rico-hace-nueva-petici-n-al-faa-para-prohibir-vuelos-provenientes-de  https://web.archive.org/web/20200506163431/https://www.fortaleza.pr.gov/content/gobierno-actualiza-datos-sobre-covid-19-en-puerto-rico-16https://web.archive.org/web/20200506165428/  https://www.faa.gov/news/updates/?newsId=94991

See OE-2020-033 Section 1, p. 5. There have not been changes in later Executive orders.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200506161028/https://www.estado.pr.gov/es/ordenes-ejecutivas/
Website from the Government and the Health Department with informative videos and other contents. https://web.archive.org/web/20200506104108/https://www.contagiahabitossaludables.com/

The Government expands the list of workplaces that can be open, but taking especial measures (appointments, social distancing). The list includes, amongst others, banks (for specific issues), animal shelters, hardware stores and garages. https://web.archive.org/web/20200506111819/https://www.fortaleza.pr.gov/content/comunicado-de-prensa-gobernadora-v-zquez-garced-emite-orden-ejecutiva-2020-038-que-extiende

Although it is mentioned that people are required to stay at home 24/7, they are allowed to leave to buy essential items or if they have a medical appointment from 5am until 7pm, or to exercise outdoors (new) from 5am until 3pm. https://web.archive.org/web/20200506111819/https://www.fortaleza.pr.gov/content/comunicado-de-prensa-gobernadora-v-zquez-garced-emite-orden-ejecutiva-2020-038-que-extiende
https://web.archive.org/web/20200506190028/https://www.fortaleza.pr.gov/content/comunicado-de-prensa-gobernadora-v-zquez-garced-emite-orden-ejecutiva-2020-038-que-extiende

May 08: A second payment of the economic incentive of $3,500 was made to municipal police officers. The governor stated: “We are disbursing a second incentive payment of $ 3,500 to 499 municipal police officers, for a total of $ 1,631,000. These payments are being worked with the Department of the Treasury, which sends them directly to the municipalities for immediate distribution, "explained the governor in a press release."  http://web.archive.org/web/20200514213938/https://www.primerahora.com/noticias/gobierno-politica/notas/desembolsan-segundo-pago-de-3500-para-policias-municipales/  May 12: The government announced that “thousand of families received the payment of the $1,200 of the CARES Act.”  http://web.archive.org/web/20200514213951/https://twitter.com/fortalezapr/status/1260619611504103424  http://web.archive.org/web/20200514214053/https://www.primerahora.com/noticias/gobierno-politica/notas/gobernadora-anuncia-que-otras-231111-familias-recibieron-los-1200/  May 13: “$ 447 million has already been disbursed for unemployment benefit payment”  http://web.archive.org/web/20200514213951/https://twitter.com/fortalezapr/status/1260619611504103424  May 13: “141,219 claimants receiving unemployment benefits. 71% receive between $ 157 and 190 weekly, plus $ 600 in federal supplemental aid”  http://web.archive.org/web/20200514214053/https://twitter.com/DTRHPR/status/1260625360061960192  May 14: The government announced the disbursement of $9.7 million of the funds of the Restart program to serve as incentive for 7,540 workers of the agency that "met the academic goals associated with the META-PR tests and graduation rate. Among those benefiting from the incentive ranging from $ 1,000 to $ 2,000 are teachers, school principals, and support staff such as librarians, social workers, and professional counselors."  http://web.archive.org/web/20200514214107/https://www.elnuevodia.com/noticias/locales/nota/unos7540empleadosdeeducacionrecibiranhasta2000enincentivo-2568581/

Government freezes the payment of income tax obligations.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509084553/https://dre.pt/home/-/dre/130779505/details/maximized    "Em 9 de março, o Governo decidiu prorrogar o prazo de cumprimento de obrigações fiscais (declarativas e de pagamento) relativas ao Imposto sobre o Rendimento das Pessoas Coletivas, nomeadamente adiando o Pagamento Especial por Conta de 31 de março de 2020 para 30 de junho de 2020, prorrogando a entrega da declaração Modelo 22 de 31 de maio de 2020 para 31 de julho de 2020 e prorrogando o primeiro pagamento por conta e o primeiro pagamento adicional por conta de 31 de julho de 2020 para 31 de agosto de 2020."

Nightclubs and similar establishments are required to close, bars and restaurants have to limit the number of customers  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509095926/https://www.portugal.gov.pt/download-ficheiros/ficheiro.aspx?v=10317e83-589c-49b6-91ab-26341e747058

Government implements an extraordinary income support scheme to workers who need to stay home to take care of dependants and to those who had lost their income due to reduction in economic activity. This is caped at 50% of the income or the minimum wage for informal workers (700 euros per month).    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509072543/http://www.seg-social.pt/apoio-extraordinario-a-reducao-da-atividade-economica-de-trabalhador-independente  "É criado um apoio financeiro excepcional aos trabalhadores por conta de outrem que tenham de ficar em casa a acompanhar os filhos até 12 anos, no valor de 66% da remuneração base (33% a cargo do empregador, 33% a cargo da Segurança Social). Para os trabalhadores independentes, é criado um apoio financeiro excepcional aos que tenham de ficar em casa a acompanhar os filhos até 12 anos, no valor de 1/3 da remuneração média, bem como um apoio extraordinário à redução da atividade económica de trabalhador independente e diferimento do pagamento de contribuições"

Government shuts down all schools and universities due to COVID-19.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200507073527/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/322581/portugal-government-shuts-down-all-schools-and-universities-due-to-covid-19-march-12-update-4  Quotation: Portugal will close all schools and nightclubs from next week until April 9, Reuters reported. “This is a fight for our very survival,” Reuters cited Prime Minister Antonio Costa as saying in a televised address. (date of publication 13 March 2020)  Link: https://www.atlanticcouncil.org/blogs/coronavirus-alert/coronavirus-prompts-school-closures-in-us-states-france-portugal/  This measure goes into effect from coming Monday not the past Monday, therefore, it will be 16 March 2020.

https://www.publico.pt/2020/03/17/economia/noticia/portugal-avanca-ja-suspensao-voos-paises-terceiros-ue-1908222 Bans travels from EU e other countries. Opens exeptions, but with restrictions.

https://www.sabado.pt/portugal/detalhe/estamos-on-governo-lanca-site-sobre-como-responder-ao-novo-coronavirus Government launches website specific about coronavirus centralizing information from government

All non-essential business should close their doors  "São suspensas as atividades de prestação de serviços em estabelecimentos abertos ao público, com exceção daquelas que prestem serviços de primeira necessidade ou outros serviços considerados essenciais na presente conjuntura, as quais se encontram elencadas no anexo II ao presente decreto"  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509093853/https://www.portugal.gov.pt/download-ficheiros/ficheiro.aspx?v=3f8e87a6-3cf1-4d0c-b5ee-72225a73cd4f

Due to the declaration of the emergency state, all public activities and events are suspended  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509093853/https://www.portugal.gov.pt/download-ficheiros/ficheiro.aspx?v=3f8e87a6-3cf1-4d0c-b5ee-72225a73cd4f    São encerradas as "atividades em espaços abertos, espaços e vias públicas, ou espaços e vias privadas equiparadas a vias públicas"

Government prohibits religious services to avoid gatherings and limits the attendance of participants in funerals.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509093853/https://www.portugal.gov.pt/download-ficheiros/ficheiro.aspx?v=3f8e87a6-3cf1-4d0c-b5ee-72225a73cd4f  "Fica proibida a realização de celebrações de cariz religioso e de outros eventos de culto que impliquem uma aglomeração de pessoas.  2 - A realização de funerais está condicionada à adoção de medidas organizacionais que garantam a inexistência de aglomerados de pessoas e o controlo das distâncias de segurança, designadamente a fixação de um limite máximo de presenças, a determinar pela autarquia local que exerça os poderes de gestão do respetivo cemitério."

Limits in the number of passengers in public transport to 1/3 of capacity  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509093853/https://www.portugal.gov.pt/download-ficheiros/ficheiro.aspx?v=3f8e87a6-3cf1-4d0c-b5ee-72225a73cd4f     "O estabelecimento da redução do número máximo de passageiros por transporte para um terço do número máximo de lugares disponíveis, por forma a garantir a distância adequada entre os utentes dos transportes"

Members of the general population (those who do not have symptoms and are not part of the risk group) can only leave their houses for essential activities.  Link decree: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509093853/https://www.portugal.gov.pt/download-ficheiros/ficheiro.aspx?v=3f8e87a6-3cf1-4d0c-b5ee-72225a73cd4f  Link news release: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509093328/https://www.portugal.gov.pt/pt/gc22/comunicacao/noticia?i=governo-define-limitacoes-de-deslocacao-e-iniciativa-economica  "Ao conjunto restante da população, que não integra nenhum grupo de risco nem está doente ou em vigilância ativa, «impende o dever geral de recolhimento domiciliário, devendo a todo o custo evitar deslocações para fora do domicílio para além das necessárias»"

President Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa declared a 15-day nationwide state of emergency on March 18, which restricted non-essential travel and led thousands of businesses to close their doors.  Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200507080434/https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-health-coronavirus-portugal/portugal-prepares-to-extend-state-of-emergency-as-deaths-rise-to-187-idUKKBN21J5OI

Parliament approved exceptional measures suspending evictions and cuts in the provision of water, gas, and electricity due to income loss caused by the coronavirus.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200509085737/https://www.publico.pt/2020/03/18/politica/noticia/medidas-excepcionais-aprovadas-nao-ha-despejos-corte-agua-luz-1908429    "sejam suspensas as acções de despejo durante o período em que vigorar a pandemia e que não possam ser cortados os abastecimentos de água, luz ou gás por falta de pagamento devido a desemprego, quebra dos rendimentos ou por o cliente sofrer de covid-19"

https://www.sabado.pt/portugal/detalhe/coronavirus-portugal-vai-entrar-na-fase-de-mitigacao-o-que-vai-mudar  In mitigation phase, people with mild symptons will be recommended to stay home and only severe cases are be sent to hospital.

On 4th of May Portugal started the first phase in easing the restrictions[14]:    Barbers and hair salons are open but with health restrictions and appointments;  Small shops with less than 200m2 can open but cannot have more than 5 clients/100m2 and all should use masks;  People can use the public transportation if remote work cannot be achieved. Can only be filled until 2/3 and all passengers must use a mask;  All public services are open to everyone with an appointment and is an obligation the use of a mask;  Physical exercise only in the outdoor;  Libraries and Archives are open;  Cannot have more than 10 people together.    Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200506233239/https://expresso.pt/coronavirus/2020-05-03-Isto-e-tudo-o-que-pode-voltar-a-fazer-a-partir-desta-segunda-feira--mas-lembre-se-mantem-se-o-dever-civico-de-recolhimento--1

Recoded original note by William Dowling: "An epidemiological alert, after an emergency meeting held by WHO and after this organization ruled the international emergency declaration. https://web.archive.org/web/20200519070657/https://www.mspbs.gov.py/covid-19-actualizacion.php Ministry of Health sends a tweet reposting OPS/OMS on information about COVID-19. Also reposts a tweet from Migrations Paraguay saying they will begin coordinating the protocols for prevention and detection of COVID-19 for people entering the country. (https://twitter.com/opsoms/status/1220360540909965313) On Jan 25th Paraguay's Ministry of Health posted the following tweet (translated): "Paraguay on alert for new coronavirus • The aim is to strengthen surveillance and immediate notification of a suspected respiratory case related to travel in affected areas. • It is present in China, Thailand, Japan, Korea and in the United States." (https://twitter.com/msaludpy/status/1221040016148725760)"

Partial and temporary closure of immigration control posts at borders as a measure against the risk of expansion of the coronavirus. General restriction on internal movement from 20:00 to 4:00, with a few exceptions. https://www.presidencia.gov.py/archivos/documentos/DECRETO3456_qgov9hok.pdf

I checked and re-coded Natalia Espinola’s data: “General preventive isolation of complete 24hs that began on March 21 continues until April 12, with a few exceptions of people who can go out and work for specific areas. Ñangareko is a program of monetary transfers of G. 500.000 for the purchase of food and hygiene products. The target population were people with needs (workers or not) and those who did not benefit from other social programs such as Tekopora and pensions for the elderly. The population that started receiving the transfers since March 31. Until April 26, 328.045 individuals were notified of their inclusion in the programme. The monetary assistance was been transferred to 224.001 families.  With the programme the government is replacing less than 50% of lost salary of workers. Here’s the links of the news reports that explain the programme:   http://web.archive.org/web/20200504191513/https://www.lanacion.com.py/pais/2020/03/30/manana-inicia-transferencia-del-programa-nangareko/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200504183917/https://www.abc.com.py/edicion-impresa/suplementos/economico/2020/04/26/asistencia-social-y-la-experiencia-en-el-uso-de-medios-de-pago-electronicos-en-programas-nangareko-y-pytyvo/

March 31. The Ministries of Health and Information Technologies launched a platform to report of individuals in quarantine, geolocalization, control and monitoring of the patients, linked to Migrations, National Police and Ministry of Health. Here’s the link:  https://www.mspbs.gov.py/que-esta-haciendo-el-ministerio-de-salud-covid19.html

Depending on the monthly consumption of the household, the electricity payments may be completely condoned for the receipts of March, April and May. The same goes for other utility payments, specially for medium and small companies, and for vulnerable sectors.  The incapacity of the citizens to pay rent will not be ground for eviction until June, “provided that the payment of at least 40% (forty percent) of the monthly rental value is justified.” Here’s the link where the explanation of the government's measures can be found:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200429211528/https://oiss.org/pt/principales-medidas-adoptadas-por-el-gobierno-paraguayo-ante-la-pandemia-covid-19/

The Decree 3525 issued on April 9 extended the preventive general isolation until April 19. The transit of people and vehicles is restricted. However, except for minor exceptions, the Ministry of Public Infrastructure and Communications will regulate public transport. The use of face masks  is mandatory. Here’s the link of the decree:  https://www.mspbs.gov.py/dependencias/portal/adjunto/9edeee-decreto3525.PDF  The President of Paraguay announced that the lockdown will be extended until April 26:  https://www.infobae.com/america/america-latina/2020/04/17/paraguay-anuncio-que-extendera-la-cuarentena-por-coronavirus-hasta-el-26-de-abril/

There have been several extensions of the general order of social distancing put in place on 21 of march. The latest extension was ordered 24/04 until 03/05. On 9/04 the Decree 3525 established that only cars with certain plate numbers could be on the streets, requiring people to only leave their house on certain days of the week and under minimal exceptions.   Relevant decrees, from most recent to oldest:  https://www.presidencia.gov.py/archivos/documentos/DECRETO3564_krgur8kc.PDF ***///*** https://www.presidencia.gov.py/archivos/documentos/decreto%203537_zhhpbm8a.pdf ***///*** https://www.presidencia.gov.py/archivos/documentos/DECRETO3525_sczobugk.PDF ***///*** https://www.presidencia.gov.py/archivos/documentos/DECRETO3512_h3is6zsi.PDF ***///*** https://www.presidencia.gov.py/archivos/documentos/decreto%203490_io7do1cg.pdf ***///*** https://www.presidencia.gov.py/archivos/documentos/decretos_1_20200321125422555%203478_o342kdv9.pdf ***///*** https://www.presidencia.gov.py/archivos/documentos/DECRETO3456_qgov9hok.pdf

The Pytyvo programme consists on a  subsidy or economic transfer of G. 548.210 focused on the population that is self-employed or employees that work on small companies (including those of informal sectors). The first payment of the Pytyvo was made on April 15. Until April 26, 890.241 individuals were benefited. However, the number of beneficiaries is constantly changing since people can apply to the subsidy. With the programme the government is replacing less than 50% of lost salary of workers. Here’s the links that explain the programme:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200504183917/https://www.abc.com.py/edicion-impresa/suplementos/economico/2020/04/26/asistencia-social-y-la-experiencia-en-el-uso-de-medios-de-pago-electronicos-en-programas-nangareko-y-pytyvo/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200504191436/https://www.ultimahora.com/mas-280-mil-personas-pueden-cobrar-partir-hoy-el-pytyvo-n2880079.html

"It called upon citizens and residents to cooperate with the directorates of the Ministry of Health in all governorates and abide by the WHO recommendations regarding the disease, which include using paper tissues to cover the mouth and nose when sneezing and coughing, upholding personal hygiene and safe nutritional practices, washing the hands with soap and water or other antiseptics, avoiding kissing and contact with anyone suffering from cold or flu-like symptoms without taking the necessary precautions, and seeking medical care in the event of fever, cough or breathing difficulties."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200430125550/http://english.wafa.ps/page.aspx?id=w5WjuTa115164968259aw5WjuT

Government of Palestine declared State of emergency in all Palestinian-controlled territory for 30 days on 05 March. It's measures included ban of mass gatherings, celebrations, protests, and strikes, and the cancellation of major sporting events and other large gatherings.   Note: Although it was announced for all Palestinian territories, in Hamas controlled Gaza no special measures were being taken yet beyond having those entering the enclave quarantine for 14 days. Since it was announced for all the territories, it entered as 'General'  Sources:   https://web.archive.org/web/20200427170034/https://www.timesofisrael.com/pa-shutters-west-bank-israel-quarantines-bethlehem-after-coronavirus-found/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200427170525/https://www.france24.com/en/20200305-palestinians-announce-west-bank-tourism-ban-over-coronavirus    On 22 March, the government rolled out even stricter measures which required all the citizens to stay home till the end of State of Emergency and closure of all but essential services to limit gathering.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200427171541/http://www.emro.who.int/images/stories/palestine/documents/Palestine_Authority_COVID-19_Response_Plan_Final_26_3_2020.pdf?ua=1    On 3 April, the government extended the State of Emergency by 30 days.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200427171629/http://xinhuanet.com/english/2020-04/04/c_138945282.htm

Government of Palestine declared State of emergency in all Palestinian-controlled territory for 30 days on 05 March. It's measures included ban of mass gatherings, celebrations, protests, strikes, and other large gatherings.   Note: Although it was announced for all Palestinian territories, in Hamas controlled Gaza no special measures were being taken yet beyond having those entering the enclave quarantine for 14 days. Since it was announced for all the territories, it entered as 'General'  Sources:   https://web.archive.org/web/20200427170034/https://www.timesofisrael.com/pa-shutters-west-bank-israel-quarantines-bethlehem-after-coronavirus-found/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200427170525/https://www.france24.com/en/20200305-palestinians-announce-west-bank-tourism-ban-over-coronavirus    On 22 March, the government rolled out even stricter measures which required all the citizens to stay home till the end of State of Emergency and closure of all but essential services to limit gathering.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200427171541/http://www.emro.who.int/images/stories/palestine/documents/Palestine_Authority_COVID-19_Response_Plan_Final_26_3_2020.pdf?ua=1    On 3 April, the government extended the State of Emergency by 30 days.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200427171629/http://xinhuanet.com/english/2020-04/04/c_138945282.htm

The state of emergency declared urges people to refrain from travelling between regions, but given the lack of mention for public transport and the publications by the PA about fumigating busses, it seems that in fact it is still running (thus corrected here) until the general lockdown enacted in Mar 22. https://web.archive.org/web/20200430102006/http://english.wafa.ps/page.aspx?id=ctGcj9a115309634715actGcj9 https://web.archive.org/web/20200430123505/http://english.wafa.ps/page.aspx?id=Qy0UOua115304875950aQy0UOu  (Ben Luria: Changed from T to G, given that we refer to the PA as the relevant entity of Palestine, thus covering the policies in the West Bank as general policies)

Government of Palestine declared State of emergency in all Palestinian-controlled territory for 30 days on 05 March. It restricted the movement between different PA governorates and cities to only necessary traffic, especially travel to and from Bethlehem.  Note: Although it was announced for all Palestinian territories, in Hamas controlled Gaza no special measures were being taken yet beyond having those entering the enclave quarantine for 14 days.   Sources:   https://web.archive.org/web/20200427170034/https://www.timesofisrael.com/pa-shutters-west-bank-israel-quarantines-bethlehem-after-coronavirus-found/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200427170525/https://www.france24.com/en/20200305-palestinians-announce-west-bank-tourism-ban-over-coronavirus    A government response plan document released on 22 March confirmed that movement between West Bank governorates was restricted.  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200427171541/http://www.emro.who.int/images/stories/palestine/documents/Palestine_Authority_COVID-19_Response_Plan_Final_26_3_2020.pdf?ua=1    (Ben Luria: Changed from T to G, given that we refer to the PA as the relevant entity of Palestine, thus covering the policies in the West Bank as general policies)

"The response included a two-week ban on tourists visiting cities and sites in the occupied West Bank, and the cancellation of major sporting events and other large gatherings.". Later extended.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200430124736/https://www.france24.com/en/20200305-palestinians-announce-west-bank-tourism-ban-over-coronavirus

The state of emergency declaration marks the beginning of a coordinated public information campaign at Mar 5. Quoted from the C19 Response Plan document by the PA (unable to archive, original link attached): "The GoP immediately declared a State of Emergency when the first cases in the State of Palestine were diagnosed on 5 March 2020 and launched robust national containment measures, supported by an evidence-based communications campaign to encourage our citizens to protect themselves and follow government guidance."    https://web.archive.org/web/20200430102006/http://english.wafa.ps/page.aspx?id=ctGcj9a115309634715actGcj9  http://www.emro.who.int/images/stories/palestine/documents/Palestine_Authority_COVID-19_Response_Plan_Final_26_3_2020.pdf?ua=1

"Prime Minister Mohammad Shtayyeh, speaking on the official Palestine TV, said that based on the powers granted to him in the decree by President Mahmoud Abbas, he decided to shut down all educational facilities, all tourist and religious areas, national parks, and cancel all hotel reservations for foreign tourists.". That is for the initial time period of a month, starting March 6 (which was later extended) https://web.archive.org/web/20200430102006/http://english.wafa.ps/page.aspx?id=ctGcj9a115309634715actGcj9 (Ben Luria: Changed from T to G, given that we refer to the PA as the relevant entity of Palestine, thus covering the policies in the West Bank as general policies)

Since March 6, a state of emergency was enacted, "shutting down the country". However, in the official documentation no reference to shutting down all workplaces, but rather that PM Shtayyeh "decided to shut down all educational facilities, all tourist and religious areas, national parks, and cancel all hotel reservations for foreign tourists", and restrict movement between towns. https://web.archive.org/web/20200430102006/http://english.wafa.ps/page.aspx?id=ctGcj9a115309634715actGcj9 (Ben Luria: Changed from T to G, given that we refer to the PA as the relevant entity of Palestine, thus covering the policies in the West Bank as general policies)

Starting March 22 at night, a stricter lockdown was enacted - thus narrowing the workplaces to only essential services (at least officially, whereas it seems that was practically perhaps the case since the March 6 emergency state). The state of emergency was extended on April 3 to 30 more days.  "Life came to a standstill in all West Bank cities and towns today as the curfew and strict lockdown Prime Minister Mohammad Shtayyeh has declared yesterday in order to stop the spread of the deadly coronavirus disease, Covid-19, went into effect since 10:00 p.m. last night."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200430102001/http://english.wafa.ps/page.aspx?id=Qsn9d0a115639893006aQsn9d0  https://web.archive.org/web/20200430102001/http://english.wafa.ps/page.aspx?id=Qsn9d0a115639893006aQsn9d0

Starting March 22 at night, a stricter lockdown was enacted - thus narrowing the workplaces to only essential services (at least officially, whereas it seems that was practically perhaps the case since the March 6 emergency state) and the access to public transportation. The state of emergency was extended on April 3 to 30 more days.  "Life came to a standstill in all West Bank cities and towns today as the curfew and strict lockdown Prime Minister Mohammad Shtayyeh has declared yesterday in order to stop the spread of the deadly coronavirus disease, Covid-19, went into effect since 10:00 p.m. last night."  https://web.archive.org/web/20200430102001/http://english.wafa.ps/page.aspx?id=Qsn9d0a115639893006aQsn9d0

On 22 March, the GoP rolled out stricter suppression measures in the West Bank, preventing movement between governorates, closing all non-essential facilities, and asking the citizens in the West Bank to stay at home for 14 days, except for essential activities and emergencies. The Palestine Monetary Authority has postponed monthly/periodic loan repayments to all borrowers for the next four months, and for the tourism and hotel sectors for the next six months. It has also prohibited the collection of fees, commissions or additional interest on deferred payments. These measures are subject to extension.  https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

The second press conference of the 'Supreme Committee for Crisis Management' mentioned: "We would like to remind you here of the importance of remaining at home, except for necessities". There's a dilemma here, given that it is not phrased in a way that mentions a regulated order; on the other hand, I could not find such direct order later and it seemed that in practice there was a stay-at-home routine. Thus currently marking as 2G (and basing also on Anna Petherick's Apr-18 judgement), but if a local could confirm the timeline it would be of value.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200506195057/https://www.gco.gov.qa/en/briefing-room/second-press-conference-for-the-supreme-committee-for-crisis-management/

80% of the work force of the private sector are to work from home from 1 April 2020, with certain exceptions  the working hours of employees and workers in the public and private sector who are still required to attend their workplace are reduced to 6 hours per day from 07.00 - 13.00, although some projects considered to be in the national interests have been exempted from this restriction    https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.pinsentmasons.com/out-law/analysis/coronavirus-impact-construction-qatar

Recommendations to stay home still stand, as of Apr 20 press conference, thus act in practice as a recommendation to not travel as well.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200506195742/https://www.qatar-tribune.com/Latest-News/ArtMID/423/ArticleID/29243/Gradual-lifting-of-Industrial-Area-lockdown-to-begin-on-Wednesday-Khater  https://web.archive.org/web/20200506200742/https://www.gco.gov.qa/en/briefing-room/ninth-press-conference-by-the-supreme-committee-for-crisis-management/

Starting on 25/02/2020, an online information campaign was launched on the official Government of Romania Facebook page on the "Prevention and limitation of eventual infection with coronavirus". New, updated information has since been provided daily on the facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/guv.ro).     On the 24/02/2020, this campaign was announced: "The information campaign of the population regarding the infection with COVID-19 will be extended, as well as the individual and collective prevention measures which should be taken and a daily newscast will be drafted regarding the development at international level and possible additional measures taken by the Romanian authorities" (https://www.nineoclock.ro/2020/02/24/pm-designate-orban-urges-romanians-to-learn-about-coronavirus-from-official-sources-only/)
https://web.archive.org/web/20200428031855/https://www.nineoclock.ro/2020/02/27/person-found-positive-with-covid-19-arrives-at-matei-bals-institute-in-bucharest/
Romania requires quarantine for arrivals from Italy, China and South Korea; https://adz.ro/inland/artikel-inland/artikel/isolation-fuer-einreisende-aus-weiteren-gebieten
Schools with COVID-19 cases must close immediately; https://adz.ro/inland/artikel-inland/artikel/coronavirus-direktfluege-von-und-nach-italien-vorlaeufig-eingestellt

All flights operated by economic operators to Spain and from Spain to Romania shall be suspended for all airports in Romania for a period of 14 days. The measure applies starting with March 18, 2020, at 18.00, Romanian time. https://web.archive.org/web/20200430212945/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-1-din-17-martie-2020

MILITARY ORDINANCE no. 1 of March 17, 2020 bans any event that involves the participation of over 100 people (including private events, takes effect March 22nd); https://web.archive.org/web/20200426194421/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-1-din-17-martie-2020
Bucharest reduces public transport fleet https://web.archive.org/web/20200428025924/https://www.romania-insider.com/reduced-fleet-public-transport-bucharest-march-2020

Romania closes hopping malls and dental clinics, adding to a nationwide shuttering of restaurants and other gathering venues. https://web.archive.org/web/20200428034526/https://www.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-romania/romania-imposes-curfew-to-slow-coronavirus-spread-idUSL8N2BE0XD

MILITARY ORDINANCE no. 2 sets out a long list of recommendations to limit travel to a limited set of circumstances (Art. 4). While not banning intra-regional travel, the recommendations amount to a recommendation to limit such movements. Hence, coded as 1G; https://web.archive.org/web/20200426195101/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-2-din-21-03-2020-privind-masuri-de-prevenire-a-raspandirii-covid-19

Romania decided to close the borders to foreigners, except residents, relatives of Romanian citizens and expatriate workers.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200428025206/https://www.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-romania/romania-imposes-curfew-to-slow-coronavirus-spread-idUSL8N2BE0XD

A Government Emergency Ordinance (GEO 30/2020) has been published, outlining social protection measures during the state of emergency due to COVID-19. The measures introduced by GEO 30/2020 come into force on 21 March 2020.    'The Labor Code provides that employers can decide unilaterally to suspend individual employment agreements of their employees and place the employees in technical unemployment. The employer is required to ensure from its own funds the payment of a minimum allowance of 75% of the employee’s base salary. However, if the employers meet one of the following criteria, during the state of emergency, the technical unemployment allowance can be supported by the Unemployment Insurance Budget up to the limit of 75% of the average gross salary provided for under the law for the social insurance budget for 2020'.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200502180616/https://home.kpmg/ro/en/home/insights/2020/03/social-protection-measures-during-the-state-of-emergency.html

MILITARY ORDINANCE no. 2 of March 21, 2020 bans gatherings of more than 3 persons who do not live together (takes effect March 22; https://web.archive.org/web/20200426195101/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-2-din-21-03-2020-privind-masuri-de-prevenire-a-raspandirii-covid-19

MILITARY ORDINANCE no. 2 sets out exceptions, but calls for staying at home in other cases. However, only between 2200-0600 (night time), these are mandatory. Therefore coded as 1G (since vast majority of movement is not at night time); Takes effect March 23; https://web.archive.org/web/20200426195101/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-2-din-21-03-2020-privind-masuri-de-prevenire-a-raspandirii-covid-19

Individuals are still allowed to go to their work place, there is no general closing: "The movement of all persons outside the home / household is prohibited, with the following exceptions : a) travel in professional interest, including between home / household and the place of professional activity and back. (...) The measure shall be applied from March 25, 2020, at 12.00."  (https://web.archive.org/web/20200428033936/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-3-din-24-03-2020-privind-masuri-de-prevenire-a-raspandirii-covid-19)     Here is the English version: https://web.archive.org/web/20200428033712/https://www.mai.gov.ro/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/ordinance-3-EN-1.pdf

Military ordinance No. 4 prohibits movement of persons outside the house / household, lists multiple exceptions (takes effect March 25); https://web.archive.org/web/20200426200618/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-3-din-24-03-2020-privind-masuri-de-prevenire-a-raspandirii-covid-19
https://www.romania-insider.com/romania-coronavirus-health-minister-bucharest-residents-tested  Bucharest (targeted geographic area), but still underway.

A military ordinance published by the Romanian authorities on 29th March capped the tariffs for electricity and thermal energy, natural gas, water supply, sanitation and fuels.    Article 8 of this ordinance states 'During the state of emergency period, the prices for electric energy and heating, natural gas, water supply, sanitation and fuel cannot be increased above the level at the issuance date of the present military ordinance; these can only be decreased according to demand and offer.'   The measure came into force on the date of publishing (29th March).    https://web.archive.org/web/20200502183003/https://www.osac.gov/Country/Romania/Content/Detail/Report/81c1698c-36ab-4bc8-826a-1852cf0f015d    https://web.archive.org/web/20200502183050/https://www.mai.gov.ro/wp-content/uploads/2019/01/ordinance-4-2020-EN.pdf

Military Ordinance no. 6 from 30.03.2020 puts  Adâncata, Salcea, Ipote?ti, Bosanci, Moara, ?cheia, Patrau?i and Mitocu Dragomirnei under quarantine, banning non-essential entry or exit into / from these communities; https://web.archive.org/web/20200426202612/https://stirioficiale.ro/hotarari/ordonanta-militara-nr-6-din-30-03-2020

'Romania’s Government adopted on Monday evening, March 30, the emergency ordinance (OUG) that allows bank debtors whose financial situation was directly or indirectly hit by the coronavirus pandemic to reschedule the repayment of their loans and get a grace period of up to nine months.'    https://web.archive.org/web/20200502184431/https://www.romania-insider.com/govt-limited-moratorium-bank-loans  https://web.archive.org/web/20200502184539/https://www.noerr.com/en/newsroom/news/romania-moratorium-on-loans

Starting on 25/02/2020, an online information campaign was launched on the official Government of Romania Facebook page on the "Prevention and limitation of eventual infection with coronavirus".
